column4: hey, you people are surely a lot better with ubuntu (gnome) than I am, so.. could anyone tell me how I could make gnome open 'window manager' on press of ctrl+alt+del
is there any way of adding custom commands to the keyboard shortcuts menu?
so, to add an universal keyboard shortcut to certain commands..
you mean like putting gnome-terminal on clt-alt-t?
for example, but gnome-terminal would be a bad example as it's available in the 'keyboard shortcuts' menu. I'm hoping to add a custom command ('knotes' for example) to a certain key combination
open gconf-editor, and navigate to apps/metacity , there's two panels: keybinding_commands and global_keybindings. You can add custom ones there
if you need more than 12, just add new keys in each
is there a commandline way as well?
um, a way to make it work without having to make a file for it?
the ubuntu icon is boring, i'm hoping to replace it with something fancier
ah, well the debian swirl is nice ;)
